n, nu=, to/ , indecl., fourteenth (later thirteenth) letter of Greek alphabet; as numeral, n/ =
50 , but n'
=
50 , 000 .
na=as, Dor. acc. pl. of nau=s (q.v.).

nabaisatreu=, barbarous word in Ar. Av. 1615 (expld. as a term of commendation);
v.l. babakatreu= .

na/bla, h(,
a musical instrument of ten or (acc. to J. AJ 7.12.3 )
of twelve strings, cj. in S. Fr. 849 , cf. LXX 1 Ki. 10.5 , al.:—also na/blas, a, o(, Sopat. 16 , Philem. 44 , Str. 10.3.17 ; cf. nau=lon
1
. (Semitic word, cf. Hebr.
nēbel; Phoenician, acc. to Ath. 4.175b .). dub. sens. in acc. to\n na/bla, OGI 175.9 (Egypt, ii B.C.).

nabl-i/zw,
= ya/llw , Gloss.

nabl-isth/s, ou=, o(,
player on the na/bla, Euph. Fr.Hist. 8 .
nabl-istoktu^peu/s, e/ws, o(, = foreg., Man. 4.185 .

nabou=s, o(,
camelopard,
IG 14.1302 (Praeneste). (Ethiopian, acc. to Plin. HN 8.69 .)

na^geu/s, e/ws, o(, (na/ssw)
pestle, Tz.ad Hes. Op. 421 .

na/gma, atos, to/,
anything piled up, as a stone wall, J. BJ 1.21.7 .

na/erra: de/spoina, Hsch.
nae/teira (nai/t- cod.): oi)kode/spoina, Id.
na^eth/r, h=ros, o(, = sq., AP 7.409 (Antip. Thess.), D.P. 455 , etc.

na^e/ths, ou, Dor.
na^e/tas, a, o(,
inhabitant, Simon. 57 , Ephipp. 5.1 (anap.), AP 9.535 , Limen. 41 , IG 5(2).474 (Megalopolis): asfem., AP 6.207.10 ( Arch. ).

nae/twr,
= na/twr , Hsch.

na_eu/w, (nao/s)
take sanctuary in a temple,
Leg.Gort. 1.39 .

nahlei=s: pro/sfatoi (Thess.), Hsch. ; cf. nealh/s. naqmo/s, o(,
reef, Id.
upright threads in a loom, Id. na/qrac, = na/rqhc , Id.

nai/, Adv., used to express strong affirmation,
yea, verily, in Hom. mostly folld. by dh/, n. dh\ tau=ta/ ge pa/nta . . kata\ moi=ran e)/eipes
Il. 1.286
, al.; n. mh/n
Emp. 76.2
; n. ma/n
Theoc. 27.27
; n. me/n
A.R. 2.151
; n. me/ntoi
Luc. Astr. 14
: used alone, se\ kri/nw, n. se/
yea thee, S. El. 1445 ; a)pokri/nasqai n. h)\ ou)/
Arist. Top. 158a16
, etc.; to\ e_ ou)k e)/sti xarakthristiko\n . . , to\ de\ a_ nai/
Choerob. in Theod. 2.85
. freq. in oaths, n. ma/
yea by . . , v. ma/; n. alone, n. ta\n *ko/ran
Ar. V. 1438
, cf. E. Ba. 534 (lyr.); n. to\n *potida=n
Epich. 81
; n. tw\ siw/
X. HG 4.4.10
; n. pro\s qew=n a)rh/cat' E. Med. 1277 . in answers,
yes, tou=t' e)th/tumon; Answ. n.
A. Pers. 738
(troch.), cf. S. El. 845 (lyr.), Pl. Tht. 193a , Grg. 448b , etc.; doubled, Ar. Nu. 1468 , Call. Fr. 1.56 P., Ev.Matt. 5.37 .
n. folld. by a)lla/, etc., to mark a qualified assent,
yes, but . . , Aeschin. 3.84 ; n., kata\ sxolh/n ge i)/sws: ou) mh/n . . Pl. Sph. 226e , cf. R. 415e .
na_t, Dor. poet. dat. of nau=s.
*na/i+-a [na_], ta/ , festival of Zeus *na/i+os, at Dodona, IG 5(2).118.21 (Tegea); written *na=a ib. 2.1318 .

*nai+-a^ko/s, h/, o/n,
of the Naiads, lime/nes
AP 10.21
( Phld. ).

*nai/+-arxos, o(, perh.
warden of temple of Zeus *na/i+os, SIG 1206.7 (Dodona).

*nai+-a/s, Ion.
*nhi+a/s, a/dos, h(, (na/w)
Naiad, river-nymph, spring-nymph, Od. 13.104 , 356 (pl.): in sg., A.R. 1.626 :—also *nai/+s, Ion.
*nhi/+s, i/+dos, h( , in sg., nhi/+s *)abarbare/h
Il. 6.22
; nu/mfh te/ke nhi/+s
14.444
, cf. Pi. P. 9.16 , E. Hel. 187 (lyr.): pl. *nai/+des, Str. 10.3.10 , Paus. 8.4.2 , etc.

naida^mw=s, Com. form of nai/,
yes certainly, opp. ou)damw=s or mhdamw=s, Com.Adesp. 1086 .

na_i/+dion [i^d], to/ , Dim. of
nao/s, Plb. 6.53.4 , Str. 8.6.21 .

naieta/w, in pres. forms, -a/w
Od. 9.23 , -a/ei
Hes. Th. 775 , -a/ousi
Il. 4.45 ; freq. in part. naieta/wn, Od. 6.245 , al., acc. -a/onta
4.96 , etc., fem. -a/wsa (v.l. -a/ousa) Il. 2.648 , 3.387 , 6.415 , Od. 1.404 , 8.574 (-o/wsa Aristarch.ad Il. 6.415 ): Ion.
impf.
naieta/askon
Il. 2.841
, etc.: (nai/w): of persons,
dwell, freq. in Ep. ; toi\ e)pi\ xqoni\ naiet a/ousi
Od. 6.153
, cf. Hes. Th. 564 ; h(=| e)/ni naieta/aske

: c. dat. loci, *lakedai/moni n.
Il. 3.387
; *krh/th|
Od. 17.523
; u(po\ xqoni/

; u(po\ o(/rois, a)mfi\ . . qe/meqla naieta/ontes, Pi. O. 6.78 , P. 4.180 . c.acc. loci,
dwell in, inhabit, *la/risan, *)iqa/khn, etc., Il. 2.841 , Od. 9.21 , etc.; dw/mata

naie/tis, idos, h(, fem. of *naie/ths,
= nae/ths , Call.in PSI 9.1092.58 .
nai/ki, barbarism for nai/xi in Ar. Th. 1183 , 1218 .

naikish/rhs, es,
one who sneers or
carps, Pherecr. 222 , Hermipp. 90 .

naikissoreu/w,
disparage, Hsch.

na_i+ko/s, h/, o/n,
of a temple, eu)/qunoi
GDI 1370
(Dodona).

naineu/rh: nh\ to\n *)/arh, *)attikoi\ de\ podoka/kh, Hsch.
nai=on,
v. na/w .
na/i+os, a, on, Dor. for nh/i+os.
*na/i+os [a_], o( , epith. of Zeus at Dodona, GDI 1567 ,al., Sch. Il. 16.233 :—also *na=os, GDI 1563 ,al.; also at Carthaea, IG 12(5).551 (cf. p.329 ).

naio/s,
= nao/s , Clinias ap.Sch. A.R. 2.1085 , cf. Hsch.

nai=ron, to/, a plant used in perfumery; prob.
f.l. for ma=ron (q.v.) in Thphr. HP 9.7.3 .

*nai/+s,
v. *nai+a/s .

naisieli/a, h(,
= a)poplhci/a, e)mbronthsi/a , Hsch. :—also naish/mata, Id.

na_i+sk-a/rion, to/, Dim. of
nai/+skos, PMag.Par. 1.3145 , Sch. Aeschin. 1.10 , Gloss.

na_i/+sk-ion, to/, = foreg.,
*)osei/ridos
POxy. 521.4
(ii A.D.). name of various
bandages, Sostratus and Apolloniusap. Gal. 12.496 Chart.

na_/i+sk-os (parox.), o(, Dim. of
nao/s,
shrine, Str. 14.1.4 , J. AJ 8.8.4 .

like ou)xi/ for ou), mh/xi for mh/, S. OT 684 , Pl. Hipparch. 232a , Men. Sam. 81 , Call. Epigr. 30.5 .

nai/w, poet. Verb, Act. (intr.) only in pres. and impf. ( Ep.
nai/eskon
Il. 5.708
), fut. and aor. in causal and Med. and Pass. forms, v. infr. 11 , 111 : of persons,

Ar. Pl. 414 , Sch. A.R. 1.664 ). In codd. usu. perispom. in both senses, A. Pr. 82 , Th. 242 , 246 , S. Ant. 705 , El. 324 , Ar. Pl. 414 , V. 758 , 922 , etc. ; even nu^n is written nu=n in codd. vett. Pi.
passim, also in S. Aj. 87 , Tr. 92 , etc. ; hence nun may freq. be restored where the sense requires it. The accent of toi/nu_^n perh. shows that both nu^n and nu_n could be enclitic.—Position : in signf. I nu=n can occupy any position ; in signf. II it prefers (like other enclitics, but also like a)/n, de/, ga/r , etc.) the second place in the sentence, e.g. pro/s nu/n se patro/s
S. Ph. 468
, cf. OC 1333 ; a)po/ nu/n me lei/pet' h)/dh
Id. Ph. 1177
(lyr.) ; meta/ nun do/s
E. Supp. 56
(lyr.) ; nu (always enclitic) precedes other enclitics and allows only de/ to precede.] (Cf. Skt.
nú, n[umacracute], nūnám, O E.
